answers.answer: Pre eclampsia is having high blood pressure which can be dangerous. Its diagnosed by have 2/3 symptoms. The symptoms are high bp(which can cause headaches and dizziness) major swelling, and protein in your urine. Im 36 weeks and have pre eclampsia. Typically your doctor will want to induce early if your bp can't be maintained. And you may be put on bed rest as well.
Yeah im 37 Weeks So Does That Affect The Baby , ? BeCause This Is My First Child And Im Getting Worried

Preeclampsia can cause your blood pressure to rise and put you at risk of brain injury. It can impair kidney and liver function, and cause blood clotting problems, pulmonary edema (fluid on the lungs), seizures and, in severe forms or left untreated, maternal and infant death. Preeclampsia affects the blood flow to the placenta, often leading to smaller or prematurely born babies. I was induced at 38 weeks with my first because I was "flirting" with it. They'll watch you very closely because it can get very serious very quickly, don't panic it's rare not days for it to go that far. I'm sure if it escalated you'll be induced

^^all very true. I'm currently 34+5 and have been diagnosed with Pre eclampsia since 32 weeks. I have been monitored extremely close. I will be induced at 37 weeks (if I make it that far). I am currently dealing with a headache that has lasted since 3 with 2 doses of tylenol. If it's not gone in the next hour I'm going in to be checked.
Thank You Both So Much I Appreciate It so Much , May God Bless You And Your Little One As Well
